Caption: Invitation to the third convocation (cover)
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30th of July, 1966. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Instituteâ€™s Open Air Theater. A total of 305 students (203 B. Tech. degrees, 38 M. Sc. degrees and 64 M. Tech. degrees) received their degrees at the ceremony. Sir A. L. Mudaliar (Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan), the Chairman of the Board of Governors, presided over the ceremony. The Chief Guest and speaker, at this historic event for the Institute, was none other than Sir C. V. Raman, the Indian Physicist and awardee of the Nobel Prize and Bharat Ratna, for his ground breaking works in the area of light scattering.
